caption_original: Today is National Blueberry Day! Did you know that berries are an important high quality food source for bears? üêª By mid-July to early August, the fruits of berry producing shrubs begin to mature. On the drier east slopes of the Rocky Mountains, buffaloberry is most common, and on the moister west slopes of the Rockies blueberry and huckleberry shrubs grow. See our website for tips on being bear aware: http://ow.ly/nPMU30ct438

Happy International Day of Rock! ü§ò If you're not a musician, rock out by visiting one of our beautiful Rocky Mountain Parks. üèî Did you know the Canadian Mountain Parks are a designated UNESCO World Heritage site? 

Some of the best-known mountain scenery on Earth is concentrated in a set of seven parks in the Canadian Rocky Mountains, including four national parks. The Burgess Shale, in Yoho, contains one of the world‚Äôs most significant finds of marine fossils.

Photo taken in Yoho National Park. Destination British Columbia

On this day in 1789 Alexander Mackenzie, accompanied by Dene leader Aw-gee-nah, became the first European explorer to reach the Arctic Ocean by paddling the entire river that would later bear his name.

Have what it takes to be a Highlander? Test your skills and take a shot with a Snider-Enfield at Halifax Citadel National Historic Site!
